channel.title: ~~~item drops!~~~

item.title: ~~~item drops!~~~
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

In NPCHandler.java, under

[code] public void MonsterDropItem(int NPCID) { {
int player = GetNpcKiller(NPCID);
client c = (client) server.playerHandler.players[player];
if (IsDropping == false) {
IsDropping = true;
int Play = GetNpcKiller(NPCID);
int Maxi = server.itemHandler.DropItemCount;

            for (int i = 0; i <= Maxi; i++) {
                if (server.itemHandler.DroppedItemsID[i] > 0) {} else {
                    int NPCID2 = NPCID + 34;

                    if (npcs[NPCID] != null
                            && server.playerHandler.players[Play] != null
                            && server.playerHandler.players[GetNpcKiller(NPCID)]
                                    != null) {[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: ~~~item drops!~~~
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

[code]public static int Name[] = {ID, ID, ID};

public static int randomName() {
    return Name[(int) (Math.random() * Name.length)];
}[/code]

Next you need to add a method that drops the item in the NPCHandler class, monsterDropItem method.

if(npcs[NPCID].npcType == ####) { ItemHandler.addItem(Item2.randomName(), npcs[NPCID].absX, npcs[NPCID].absY, 1, GetNpcKiller(NPCID), false); }

Things you need to replace:

Optional: “Name”, this can be changed to something such as jungleDemon, Demon, etc. Make sure it is the EXACT same for every part that requires the name.

= simply the npc id.

Read full topic
